A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I liked what they did with most of the characters\, but the filmmaking felt rushed and not very Star Wars-y to me. It just didn't have that look\, feel and pacing. I didn't feel that imagination-expanding Star Wars magic. It wasn't the downer of a storyline that was the problem - I think it was the constant\, anticlimactic dramatic reveals. The plot was so complicated\, so overloaded with lessons and themes\, that I felt schooled rather than led on a journey. You don't have to dot every i and cross every t to drive your themes home. It was so ambitious a movie that it kinda toppled under its own weight. In TFA\, I felt swept along by an exuberant story\, but TLJ felt like work.
